text: A lavish nightclub with leafy tables and booths built int the branches of a huge tree. The stage is the ledge of a gothic cathedral, framed by two gargoyles. The decor suggests a Deco 430s speakeasy. Now Mack takes center sta
Sure, I_ know early birds Catch all the worms -- But what kinda squirrelly birds Want breakfast that squirms? I'd rather dine with the...

Nightbirds! If dayltg ght's too bright, birds, And blue skies make va blue (Boo hoo hoo) -- You just might, bir Be nightbirds, too! APPLAUSE as the Nightingales pose. A scenic curtain falls featuring a farm with crowing rooster. Mack takes the mic

(Elvis) “Thank you, thank y’ very much.” As you know, someone very special is making his debut here tonight. (imitates OWL) “Whooo? Whooo?” Oh, the owls are getting impatient, I’1l tell you who -- Kid Bantam, that’s who! (imitates HEN) “Cluck-uck-uck-uck-bakaw!"” Listen to those hens, they love him -- staying up late, huh, ladies? Okay, don’t get your eggs in a scramble. (off loony LAUGHS in crowd) Hoo-boy, the loons are out tonight--“Hoo- hoo-hoo-hoo-hoooe!” Now lemme tell you a little about the Kid. You know his real name? First time I met him, I ask “What’s your name?” And he says, “dagnabbit, shuddup!” So I say, hey, shuddup yourself, I’m just asking. And he says, get this _- “No, that’s my name - - Dagnabbit Shuddup! Anyway, that’s what the farmer calls me.” Kid you not. True etary  From the farmyard scene on the curtain...

A real farmyard scene. The mailbox reads “FARMER FAMILY FARM. All the lights are off in the ramshackle farmhouse, and the henhouse next to it. A COW dozes with a DONKEY, P sleep together, the night is quiet. Then... Rooster DAG pops into frame, CROWING.
Brakakakak! Brakakakak! Erkakakak-aroo! His chest swells -- his throat puffs -- his wattle wobble he blasts his brassy jazz riff into the silent night.
Er-er-roooo, ba-kak! Er-roooo, ba-kak! Er-roo bak-kak-kak-kak-kak! The night starts to respond, As Dag’s crow wakes them up, the animals start to complain...

Oooooocooch.... Yawwwwwwww.... Roink! Somewhere, a dog starts to HOWL. Other DOGS join in. A light comes on in the henhouse doorway. PENNY emerges - the cutest little chick you ever saw -- wide awake and ey sparkling as she listens to Dag crow. Older HENS appear behind her, squinting, groggy and grumpy.
Get back to bed. Don’t encourage him. Now a CRYING BABY adds his voice to the cacophony -- and LIGHTS start going on in the farmhouse.
Brakaka-kak, a rooo! Brak..
Dagnabbit! Shuddup! Dag’s in musical seventh-heaven, so he doesn’t see the BO hurled out of the farmhouse window behind him... which CO him in the head, silencing him in mid-song.

Bak-kak-kak---unk! Dag sprawls, knocked unconscious. Penny moves to help -- then retreats as... THE FARMER stomps out of the house in his long-johns with length of twine in his hands. He kneels by Dag and loops knotted twin around his beak -- an improvised muzzle.
Last chance, Dagnabbit. He turns back to the house as Dag woozily comes around.. see he’s muzzled. Dag FREAKS OUT. He strains against the twine, trying to crow -- but he can only CROAK miserably.
Melp! Melp... Penny rushes to help, pecks at the muzzle. Dag pulls away

Don’t worry, I’m not gonna kiss you. But Dag’s lovestruck eyes tell us that’s the last thing h worried about. He lets Penny bite his muzzle -- they both twist and pull -- and after an awkwardly intimate moment. Penny pulls the muzzle off! Dag CROWS in delight.
(catches himself, whispers) Erk-erk-a-roo. The noise brings the older hens back to the henhouse door HENS. Keep it down! Knock it off! Go to bed, ya freaks!
Better yet -- fly the coop! Then we can all get some sleep.
You think we want to be up all night? it’s just how we are.
(righteous sniff) No better than nightbirds. The hens drift back to bed. Penny helps Dag up.
Boy, he really threw the book at you.
Aaah, I’m okay. But how ‘bout you? still getting henpecked?
You should hear what they say about you.
Maybe they’re right. Maybe we should fly the coop.
Only problem with that? We can’t fly.
We could leave.
You mean... cross the road?
Yeah.
But... why?
Why not? See what’s on the other side?

That's it? That’s your plan? “We’ll see when we get there?” “men” Roosters. ‘No idea where they’re going, and won’t even ask how to get there. Well, til you get a little more specific about your intentions, you can just cross that road by yourself, mister.
Come on, Penny, don’t be so human.
I’m not human! It’s just -- when I cross the road with a guy, I wanna know what’s on the other sidé. You get back to me when you figure out where you’re going.
Where we’re going. She smiles, softening. They nestle a little closer. Dag CROWS a soft arpeggio, sings: ("If I Could Fly”)
Talk about boring, everyone's snoring, It's not even ha past’ eight...
And here we are, staying up late Again...
Everyone's always peckin'’ and pickin’ --
“Well, she's an odd duck..."
“Man, he's one funky chicken."
I wish we could up and take flight To wherever birds stay up all night!
If I could fly, (spoken) I'd say goodbye... Why?!
To everyone but you. Whew.
If I could fly, Hey! I'd fly away --
To find us a home somewhere Ooh... new.
A home somewhere far, Where we'll be who we are...
Where we'll rest in our nest all day... Where we’ iP Sta up and play Til the night fades away...

And who gives a hoot What the other birds say! If we could fl We'd fly toget. er, Birds of a feather Across the sky, To someplace free... If only we Could fly. Penny’s eyes sparkle. Dag draws close. MUSIC continues under. They’re just about to kiss when... CONK! A package drops on Dash’s head. He spins and stumbles to the ground MUSIC stops. Penny rushes to help Dag up.

Ow! Man, I am having a bad head day. ON THE PACKAGE - which has ripped open when it hit the ground. Dag reaches down to pull out... A SOUVENIR SNOWGLOBE with a city skyline. Dag shakes it. REVERSE SHOT - Dag and Penny’s eyes are huge in the round glass, as they watch glitter swirl around the tiny city.

Hey, it’s snowing! I mean out here! DAG'S POV - The snowglobe lowers to reveal a real sky ful FLUTTERING WHITE FLAKES. No, not flakes -- pieces of mail drifting to earth. Dag and Penny stare in wonder. ON THE POSTCARDS as they land -- Fairy-tale views of a Manhattan-style city. Dag reads the printed messages.

“Live the night life...” “Join us after dark...” “The city that never sleeps!” Dag looks to Penny, amazed -- here’s their answer! Penny' eyes sparkle. They're just_about to kiss again when... THWUMP! MUSIC stops abruptly as Dag and Penny are startle apart by the crash-landing of a PIGEON right in front of them. The pigeon (HOMER ) wears a messenger vest, a mailb slung over one wing, ermos on the other.
Whoa! Hey lovebirds, sorry to interrupt, it’s just my bag spilled and... spots the snowglobe) Whoa, lucky that didn’t break.
(points to his head) No, but this did.
Sorry dude, nothing serious, right? (holds up his wings) How many wings?
Duh -- two?

Excellent, no concussion, hey, accidents happen, you got insurance, right? As he talks a mile a minute, he unslings a thermos from h shoulder and pours a cup of coffee. Like many delivery workers, Homer is hypercaffeinated.
Tell ya what, let’s be cool and not even involve the vultures, dig? And you can keep the doohickey. Dag rubs his head angrily... Penny eyes the snowglobe longingly... Dag eyes Penny longingly...
So... we cool? (off Dag’s shrug) Excellent. I’m Homer.
(as they shake wings) Dagnabbit Shuddup.
Whoa ace, say what now?
That’s his name, call him Dag, I’m Penny.
Thanks, Pen, you are one knockout chick, and one righteous rooster. What are you two doing up this time of night besides, you know, chicken-necking? You two got some nightbird in ya?
So they say.
It’s not a bad thing. He picks up scattered postcards. Dag and Penny help.
Homer, where did these come from?
The City. You never been to the City?
Is it really a “city that never sleeps?”

Brother and how. You gotta go, it’1l blow your birdy brains. The Central Park Poopery... The Statue of Lavatory... The International Airport-a-potty! (off their looks) Hey, I’ma a pigeon, the world is my tollet. best of all... (finds a postcard) Birdland! ON POSTCARD - a view of the lavish treetop nightclub.

“Home of the famous Treetop Lounge where the nightbirds sing til dawn and closing time's not til tomorrow.” Get off your tailfeathers, check it out! It’s not even that far, you can see it from here! He flutters to the roof of the farmhouse porch. Penny and Dag look helplessly at each other. Then... Dag flaps onto the roof of the henhouse... then onto a ta stack of crates. Penny follows tentatively. Dag leaps to the trellis by the porch, grabs the slats with his claws. reaches his wings out for enny -- and catches her as she jumps. Together they climb up the trellis to join Homer.. ON THE PORCH ROOF - Homer points to the distant lights of glittering skyline. Dag and Penny squint to make it out.
Wow! You think we could make it there?

Well if you can make it there, you’ll make it anywhere. (sees Penny’s reluctance) You know, you could go first -- get a job, finda place --_and come back for enny once you" re all set up. I’11 help, just _call when ya get there. I’m at the Hotel Broadwa Catch you on the flipside, fow. $! With a salute he takes off. Dag and Penny wave goodbye -- then look at the city. MUSIC UNDER ("If I Could Fly”).
It's so big... and so distant...
But it's not non-existent! Now our destination's in sight...

Just a couple of loonies, Out here in the boonies... Still we feel that it's real And it's right! So_ you and I Will keep our eyes on That far horizon Across the sky, Where we'd be free... If only we Could fly. They nestle closer, silhouetted against the moonlit sky. night itself starts to fly via TIME-LAPSE FAST-MOTION: The moon arcs downward -- they draw closer -- Dag puts a around Penny -- she draws away -- they look at the sky -- awkwardly inch together again -- Penny lays her head on Dag’s shoulder -- and he puts his wing around her.
As sunlight seeps into the sky and paints it in pastels, and Penny nestle together, dozing.
Dag? Isn't it time for you to...

Mmm? Oh yeah, okay... He tries to straighten up and crow... then realizes -- he on the edge of the roof! Groggy, he instantly falls off. Penny SQUAWKS -- then takes a brave, running leap to the crates... down to the henhouse... to the ground. The Farmer emerges from the house, passes unconscious Dag

Pathetic. He moves to open the gate for a TURNIP TRUCK as it turns As Penny runs to Dag’s side, the other Hens emerge from t henhouse, blinking and stretching in the dawn light. They stare at Penny as if she were a fallen chicken.

Pathetic. As the Farmer helps the TRUCK DRIVER load baskets of turn onto his truck, he sees... A LONG BLACK CAR approaching. It noses through the gate a SQUEALS to a stop by the Farmer. Tinted glass rolls down, replacing the Farmer’s reflection with the crabbed face o CAP'N PLUCKETT - a withered despot in a white linen suit. beady-eyed PARROT (PAULIE CRACKERS) rides on his shoulder big RHODE ISLAND RED rooster (RED) dozes at his side; a glowering HOUND DOG (GENERAL LEE) sits at his feet.  10. CAP‘N PLUCKETT Anything to sell me today, Farmer Farmer? The farmer’s shadow closes in on sleeping Dag... who awak rudely as the Farmer hoists him into the air.

How ‘bout this worthless rooster? Up all night, sleeps all day. Heck, forget selling, I’1ll give him to you. CAP‘N PLUCKETT I do have a certain interest in birds of a nocturnal nature... He pats his own sleeping rooster. The Farmer holds Dag up the window... where he attracts the attention of General The Dog GROWLS. Dag squirms. CAP'N PLUCKETT (CONT’D) But that’s not what I want to purchase.
I keep telling you, this land’s not for sale. We ain’t dead yet.

Sure you are, you just ain’t got the good sense to lie down. As the sun rises, a LARGE SHADOW FALLS over both men. REV the pastoral farm is bordered by a TOWERING BRICK WALL. A billboard at the top reads “CAP'N PLUCKETT’S POULTRY” - and features a likeness of the old Cap’n himself, lifting drumstick to his mouth with a motorized hand. Up and down goes, as the Cap’n takes the same bite forever. BACK TO SCENE: The Cap’n hands the Farmer an official- looking envelope -- NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE AND EVICTION.
Sorry about this, Farmer Farmer. Just doin’ my duty is all.

Doin’ my duty, rawk! Doin’ my duty. Now General Lee BARKS at Dag -- who kicks out and lands a swipe across the dog’s nose. Furious General Lee lunges through the window. The Farmer pulls back and drops Dag.. who runs for his life, with General Lee in hot pursuit. EXT. FARMYARD — DAWN Dag races beneath HOES and RAKES leaning against the wall knocking them over as he passes. Hot on Dag’s tail, the General stumbles and rolls over the clattering tools. He finally rights himself -- and steps right on the blade of hoe which obeys the laws of slapstick and swings upright, CONKING the dog in the noggin. With a flutter of wings, Dag leaps lightly over a haystac Behind him, General Lee plows straight through -- and tum out the other side, spitting hay and pawing it from his e  11. Dag heads straight for the gieeping MULE... and runs unde him, tickling the Mule’s belly as he goes. The Mule jagie in his sleep... then wakes abruptly, annoyed. Who woke hi up? He looks behind him to see... General Lee approaching The Dog sees the angry mule ahead, ready to kick. He trie to brake, but too late... Dag looks back as the mule BRAYS and the bog YELPS. His e follow General Lee’s brief flight and hard landing. THUD. As the Cow and Pig wake, complaining loudly, Dag races to THE HENHOUSE - He dives through the small door with Gener Lee inches behind. WHAM! The dog’s nose wedges tightly in the henhouse door.
Shaking from the impact. Feathers flying. Hens SQUAWKING alarm. Dag hurries to Penny...
Pen, remember we talked about me leaving? Penny nods. Dag points at the dog’s snout behind him, snarling and slavering as it tries to free itself.
Seems like a good time. Dag takes a peck at the snout. General Lee YOWLS and strains to pull free of the door. Dag pecks as he talks..
It'll be okay, I'll find a job, and I‘1l find a place for us to live....
Together?
(takes her hint) And I'1l find an all-night wedding chapel!
Dag, are you...?
Sure, will you...? Before Penny can answer... CRRRRRAAAACK! Wood splits as t dog pulls free, with the doorframe still jammed on his sn
Gotta go. As he leaps out the wide-open door...
Yes! The answer is yes!

General Lee’s at the base of the henhouse ramp, trying to pull the door-frame off his snout...  12. -as Dag leaps out and lands hard on the top of the ramp. The whole thing see-saws -- Dag’s end drops to the ground the other end lands an uppercut to General Lee’s jaw. The dog YOWLS. Dag skeddadles. He takes a running, flappi leap... and barely makes it to the top of the fence. Whew Angry hens watch Dag’s escape from their shattered doorwa

Good riddance. EXT. FARMYARD -— CONTINUOUS Dag races along the rail with General Lee running below, snarling jaws open to reveal a mouth full of teeth and dr The Turnip Truck is pulling out of the gate as Dag runs d the fence... and leaps off! He lands on turnips, which roll out from under him. Dag slips -- slides -- almost tumbles off. But he curls his claws around a truckbed rail and hangs on for dear life a General Lee gallops through the gate, keeping pace. The d launches himself into the air, lunging at the tailgate... Dag cringes as the dog torpedoes at him... then drops. DU illows as Lee hits the ground. Missed it by that much. J settles his tailfeathers into the truckload of turnips, watching the farm and furious General Lee shrink away.
And so our hero made the epic journe from rural heartland to sin-soaked city. A jazzy version of “(Get Your Kicks on) Route 66” plays a
DAG’‘S ROAD-TRIP MONTAGE - Bucolic heartland pastures pas as a SUPERIMPOSED ROAD MAP charts the truck’s progress wi
dotted line... Rural road signs become highway markers: R 66, US 10 Forests and lakefronts give way to suburban sprawl as... that DOTTED LINE nears a BIG CITY on the map
He’s a little fuzzy on the details, since he was traveling by day... ON THE TRUCK BED -- where Dag dozes on turnips, SNORING.
-so he pretty much slept through the whole trip. PULL BACK TO REVEAL the truck is now crawling in four lan of heavy traffic on...

Until the truck is just one of a thousand colorful specks crossing the water into the BIG CITY SKYLINE.  13. EXT. FARMER'S MARKET -— AFTERNOON ON DAG - jolted awake as the truck stops. His eyes open.. DAG'S POV - CITY SKYSCRAPERS soar into the sky. Dag blinks, looks again. The SKYSCRAPERS grow even taller Suddenly the truck RATTLES as the driver opens the tailga to unload. Dag SQUAWKS and leaps onto the street... Where he’s nearly CREAMED by CAR TIRES speeding past. He retreats under the truck... And emerges on the other side. Sighs with relief -- then SQUAWKS as he’s nearly trampled by sidewalk PEDESTRIANS. scurries one way to avoid RUSHING FEET -- then jumps the other way as a BICYCLE whizzes by. He dives for safety..

Dag crouches by a TRASHCAN, breathing hard as he gapes at the people and traffic barrelling past. He doesn’t see th HEAD rising out of the trash above him -- black mask arou beady eyes -- meet COONEY the raccoon.

Well well well, what we have we here, Poss? -.-Poss? Next to him in the trashcan dozes a POSSUM -- his partner crime POSS, the smaller and, at this hour, sleepier of th pair. Their partnership is a Penn—and-Teller affair, with Cooney doing all the talking.) Cooney nudges Poss awake.
Think this boy’s new in town? (calls down to Dag) Need some help, son? Dag looks around --where’s that voice coming from? He’s startled as Cooney leaps from the can and lands beside hi
I bet your mama told you not to talk to strangers, so let’s be strangers no more. I’m Cooney, and this is my partner, Poss. Poss lands on the other side, again catching Dag off-guar
Hey! Hi... I’m Dag. (off Poss’s mute reaction) Doesn’t talk much, does he?
Silent partner.
Could you tell me how to get to Birdland? Cooney and Poss trade a look -- can’t resist the set-up.  14.
Practice! Practice! (laughs, then) I could tell you were a musician.
You could? I am? See, it’s my first time in the city...

No kiddin’. Fresh off the farm, no experience, you’ll get yourself in big trouble without expert professionals to steer your career. Lucky you found us. He nudges Poss, who hands Dag a business card. Dag reads:
“Cooney & Poss, Scavenging and Hauling?” Cooney snatches the card away, as Poss hands Dag another.

“Cooney & Poss, Pest Control!” Cooney grabs Poss’s handful of business cards, fans throu them til he finds the one he wants. Hands it to Dag... DAG (CONT’D) “Cooney & Poss, Artists Management.” Shoot, I’m no artist.
We'll be the judge of that. Show us what you got -- sing, dance, whatever you do.
Oh, I just crow a little... Cooney and Poss feign eagerness. Bashful, Dag clears his throat... SQUEAKS... settles... and starts to CROW.
Brakakaw, brakakaw, brakakeeeee... baby! Brakakaw brakakaw... ON A WINDOW LEDGE high above, Mack the mockingbird is adjusting his tie in the window’s reflection, singing:

Listen to the mockingbird, oh that crazy mockingbird... He stops as he hears Dag crowing below. Bops to the beat hey, not bad. He looks for the source of the sound... BACK TO SCENE -- as Dag finishes big.
Brakak, brakeek, babop-dop-deep dra-kow!

Whoa, dig that crazy sound. You got a lotta talent. But not a lotta know-how, nachaur Van naad a anand mananar  15. Cooney starts to rub Dag’s shoulders with his paws... As he talks, Cooney siyly lifts a corner of Dag’s left wi Poss reaches underneat! poking around for a pocket to pic
We’ll make sure ya meet the right birds. Get the best gigs... Poss shakes his head, nothing. So Cooney lifts the right wing while Poss pokes. -
And above_all, make sure nobody exploits you. Really, "thirty percent’s a small price to pay.
Thirty percent of what?... Hey! Dag’s caught Poss in the act. Cooney scrambles to cover..

He's pest checking your measurements, you'll need some new outfits. First we jet you a stylist, some good pictures, I now some guys, I’ll get you a deal. Then we'll get you a personal trainer... (off Dag’s reaction) You’re no spring chicken, bubbe, those drumsticks need definition. All at minimal cost, a small investment in your future, how much money do you have, anyway, and where do you keep it? Actually, r aeinda left home in a hurry today. I didn’t bring any cash. Cooney and Poss trade looks -- and change moods. Cooney flexes his claws, grabs Dag by the shoulders.

Listen, 2°, rube, this is the City, you wanna make it here, it costs money. Now are you gonna help us help you? Or do we have to shake it outta you? Cooney shoves frightened Dag against a wall. Then... the raccoon’s expression changes from menace to pain.
Yow! REVEAL mockingbird Mack has landed squarely on Cooney’s h grabbing a furry ear in each claw.
geagney) You dirty overgrown furry rat -- let him go, or the ears come off. (digs in; Pacino/Scarface) I‘ll rip em off and shove em up your nose, say goo’bye to your leetle yeriends!  16.
Yaaaaaaa, get off me! He releases Dag. Scared Poss or dies onto his back, playi ossum. As Cooney escapes grabs Poss’s tail and drags im along, racing out o the al ey. Mack looks Dag over...
New in town, kid?
How’dja know?
Lucky guess. Just fell off the turnip truck, huh?
No! ...I jumped off.
Yeah? What’s your name, kid?
Dagnabbit Shuddup.
Hey, shuddup yourself, I was just asking!
That's my name, Dagnabbit_Shuddup. That’s what the farmer calls me, anyway.
Hunh. How’s about I call you Dag? (extends a wing) | Mack the Mock, stand-up comic and stand- up bird, at your service.
Wow. You’re in show biz?
Don’t tell me -- just where you wanna be.
I never really thought about it til Mr. Cooney said..
Yeah well, forget anything that con- artist tells ya.
I suspected he wasn’t quite on the level.

What tipped you off? The burglar’s mask? The prison-stripes? Or when he tried to mug ya? Listen, kid, this town’s full of guys like Cooney, happy to take all the lough while you do a the work. You got a sweet souni kid, but you need some street-— smarts, stat. You got a job yet? Maybe I can help. Follow me!  17. He spreads his wings and takes off. Dag watches him go. After a beat... Mack returns.
What ’samatter?
Can't fly.
Oh yeah, roosters, right, I knew that. Okay, I’1l go slow so you can keep up. Hey, you know how to get to Birdland?
«..Practice?
Heard that one, hunh? Come on... As Mack takes off, Dag double-takes...
Birdland? We’re going to Birdland? And he races out of the alley...

DAG’'S POV - A HUNDRED PAIRS OF LEGS, towering above and clomping past him as he navigates the city sidewalk. Dag escapes the crunch to hug a wall -- scans the sky... Perched on a streetlight, Mack waves at Dag, flies on. DAG dodges an oncoming CYCLIST -- lands in the path of a SKATEBOARDER, who swerves in the nick of time. DAG spins the skateboard whizzes by... to find himself face-to-face with... a PACK OF SLOBBERING, GROWLING DOGS.
Brakkkk! He turns and runs. The Dogs YAP and charge after him. Luckily they’re on all leashes held by a hapless DOGWALKE
Heel! Heel! HEEL! From a telephone wire, Mack sees the Dogwalker dragged by dogs as Dag makes his escape.

Hey Dag! Grab a cab! Dag spreads his wings and takes a flying leap onto the a parked car -- and from there a passing YELLOW CAB. SPLAT! From the CABBIE’S POV -- as Dag lands and immediat gets flattened across the windshield, wings oustretched.

Hey! Move ya stupid bird...  18. Dag tries to smile at the Cabbie -- until the WINDSHIELD WIPERS start up, whipping him back and forth across the windshield. He scrambles to climb up to... THE ROOF OF THE CAB -- where he almost tumbles off -- but curls his claws around the “TAXI” signs and hangs on. MACK'S POV - Dag perches atop the cab, riding through hea traffic up a street that looks a lot like Broadway. As th cab stops at a light, we swoop down, circling above Dag..
Take a right! Dag eyes the crossing traffic, takes a running leap into TRUCK. Going in the wrong direction.
Your other right! This way! Dog reconnoiters, jumps onto a car headed the other way, his claws into the canvas top. He searches the sky for Ma
Right behind ya. Dag yelps, surprised. Mack has landed on the car top.
We get off at this next... The car hits an_ intersection and SQUEALS to a stop -- se our heroes tumbling off.

Dag and Mack land hard, rolling on the pavement. Luckily they’re stopped. : « WHAM! WHAM! By the trunk of an enorm tree. As they struggle to their feet, Dag looks up to see GOTHIC CATHEDRAL TOWERS (think St. Patrick’s) soaring abo
We're going to church?
Quite the contrary. He taps on the massive tree-trunk with his beak. A speake style PEEPHOLE OPENS. Glinting eyes and a GRUFF VOICE:
Yeah? Oh, hiya Mack. A DOOR opens in the trunk, revealing the Club Bouncer ins COCKY CACCIATORE, a burly, greying rooster.
Dag, meet Cocky Cacciatore. The Cocky Cacciatore.
Yeah? Wow.  19.
He never heard of me.
Sure I have. (off Cocky’s stare) No I haven't.
He was World Cockfighting Champ five years running is al
“Was” being the key word. Can’t expect kids to know ancient history. Hiya, Dag. They shake wings. Mack and Dag step inside. Cocky sticks his head out, yells upward

Okay, fellas. PAN UP TO REVEAL four big, burly NIGHTHAWKS perched on branches above -- each harnessed to a rope that passes in the tree and down to the elevator. The Hawks flap and tak off in four directions... pulling the elevator up.
As it rises, Cocky studies Dag.
Kinda past your bedtime, ain’t it?
Think we got a nightbird here, like you.
Yeah? Happy to welcome another freak of nature. You come to the right place kid. MUSIC begins as the elevator stops. Doors open to reveal.

Dag gapes like Dorothy in Oz as he enters Birdland, even spectacular than its postcard. On the gargoyle- framed st a_chorus line of NIGHTINGALES rehearse as the Crow Bar ba plays and a fey jaybird (BUSBY BIRDLY) directs.
Nightbirds! You came to the right birds, This place will ignite, birds, When we get hot! And we get hot a lot...
Callin’ all nightbirds, All you blackbirds and white birds-- Wanna hit a new height, birds? This is the spot! Eying Dag, Busby sings along with the chorus...  20.
You feeling blue, bird? Lost all your spark? Cheer _up, boy, and come enjoy Some laughter after dark! Mack smiles fondly as he mutters to Dag:
He’s a screaming jaybird, but he puts on a helluva show. Dag is in jazz heaven, chicken-dancing along to the band.
Man, they’re great! I can’t wait to play with them.
Hunh? Aw, no, kid, you’re not workin with the band, you’re gonna be a busbird.
(trying to hide disappointment ) Oh! Well that’s good too. I mean, I’1l still be kinda showbiz... adjacent.
DAG - now wearing a red busbird’s jacket, as Mack finishe tying Dag’s bowtie. REVEAL we're in...

Dag stands at the end of a line of Waiters and Busbirds a the NIGHTHAWK MAITRE D’ inspects his staff, singing: MAITRE D’ Another busy night, birds!
